LDAP Chai API

The LDAP Chai API, easy to use LDAP for Java developers.

See:
          Description

Packages
com.novell.ldapchai The LDAP Chai API, easy to use LDAP for Java developers.
com.novell.ldapchai.cr Contains classes for managing challenge/response values for use with forgotten passwords.
com.novell.ldapchai.cr.bean  
com.novell.ldapchai.exception Exceptions thrown by the LDAP Chai API.
com.novell.ldapchai.provider Components to maintain and manage the actual connection to the ldap directory.
com.novell.ldapchai.util Utility classes associated with the LDAP Chai API.

 

The LDAP Chai API, easy to use LDAP for Java developers. See also the LDAP Chai Project Page.

LDAP Chai is a wrapper library that makes using ldap services as simple and easy as it can be. LDAP Chai has methods for commonly used functions, and relieves developers of the need to write code that has been written many times before.

Several useful features make LDAP Chai an ideal choice for building ldap applications:

  • ldap fail-over - allows your application to easily take advantage of mirrored/replicated ldap directories that are common in enterprise environemnts. see ChaiSetting.FAILOVER_ENABLE.
  • idle connection watchdog - closes and re-opens ldap connections (sockets) automatically based on activity, keeping the connection count lower than it would be otherwise ChaiSetting.WATCHDOG_ENABLE.
  • pluggable provider interface - wraps commonly used low level LDAP APIs such as JNDI ldap api or JLDAP api for maximum compatibility. ChaiSetting.PROVIDER_IMPLEMENTATION.

LDAP Chai also has a rich library of password mangement, policy and forgotten password methods.

ChaiProvider is the foundation interface for LDAP Chai, and contains the basic ldap accessor methods. Direct use of ChaiProvider is discouraged, instead use the wrapper class ChaiEntry and its subclasses wherever practical. ChaiEntry instances wrap an LDAP DN, and relieve the caller of the necessity of working directly with String DNs.

ChaiProvider instances can be obtained using ChaiProviderFactory. Similarly, ChaiEntry instances can be obtained using ChaiFactory.
